column3:
Concept ACK

> I was just curious. What do you think about adding the word “instance” followed by the package name?

Yes, I think adding "instance" makes the sentences better.

Updated 16fad5b415efc803eab53a5c8eddd129637a78aa -> da791c7f66243080177f92ce5f38c49305da63dc ([pr23311.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr23311.01) -> [pr23311.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr23311.02), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr23311.01..pr23311.02)).\n\nThanks to all reviewers, your comments are addressed :tiger2:

ACK da791c7f66243080177f92ce5f38c49305da63dc 

Verified that changing the test assertions to just "Bitcoin Core" is equivalent.

Would it make sense to also update these 3 lines?
```
src/wallet/dump.cpp:147:        error = strprintf(_("Error: Dumpfile version is not supported. This version of bitcoin-wallet only supports version 1 dumpfiles. Got dumpfile with version %s"), version_valu
I still think we can remove PACKAGE_NAME, because it is not possible to say whether the other instance is Bitcoin Core or Bitcoin Knots, or bitcoind, or bitcoin-qt, or ...\n\nBut :shrug:
There's no reason to assume it's necessarily Bitcoin Core, though.
Maybe make it general: "Another instance may be using it.".

```suggestion
        throw std::runtime_error("SQLiteDatabase: Unable to obtain an exclusive lock on the database, is it being used by another instance of " PACKAGE_NAME "?
");
```
